channel.title: shiny on Ted Laderas, PhD
channel.description: Recent content in shiny on Ted Laderas, PhD

item.title: Data Scavenger Hunt: NHANES
item.description: An introduction to Exploratory Data Analysis using the burro app to explore outcomes using the NHANES (National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey) dataset. With Jessica Minnier and Thomas Frohwein.

item.title: Flow Dashboard Demo
item.description: A Sample App built with the flowDashboard Shiny Modules package. Meant for visualization of high throughput flow cytometry data. Repo

item.title: NHANES explorer
item.description: A Depression focused shiny app for the NHANES (National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey) dataset. Built with burro.

item.title: Things we learned teaching clinical data wrangling
item.description: Well, we just finished our clinical data wrangling workshop. This was a 12 hour workshop (spread over 4 days) where students got to work with a real research dataset (the Sleep Heart Health Study data). This is a workshop that we developed as part of an National Library of Medicine T15 training supplement in Data Science. The following is a short report describing the workshop and its outcomes. Intended Audience We designed the workshop for our incoming informatics students (both clinical and biological majors) in order to introduce them to the difficulties of working with clinical data.

item.title: Introduction to Interactive Visualization
item.description: RMarkdown/Shiny slides introducion for our BMI 569/669 Data Analytics course to interactive visualizations.

item.title: Shiny and Tidyeval Part 1
item.description: Note: sometimes I write these posts to teach myself a better way to do things in R. I have been avoiding tidyeval somewhat, because I seem to have a bit of a learning block about it. I’m going to try to write some posts that help me understand what’s going on with Tidy Evaluation. Using sym() in a Shiny App One fairly simple Shiny Application might be selecting a column of the dataset and then doing something with it, such as using it in a select() or filter() statement.

item.title: Introduction to Data Literacy
item.description: LearnR Tutorial introducing our HSMP Health Informatics Class to data literacy concepts. Based on a great LearnR tutorial from Mikhail Popov. Repo

item.title: A gRadual Introduction to Shiny
item.description: I just gave a workshop teaching the basics of Shiny (the interactive web visualization framework) for a group of PDX R users. We had 10 people attend, and most of the attendees managed to get through the material and had lots of good questions. I really enjoyed talking with everyone and I hope everyone learned something. We’re planning to give the workshop again to the larger PDX R user community, and some of the attendees last night have volunteered to be TAs.

item.title: Decision Tree Explorer
item.description: Simple Shiny App to explore decision tree building with the party paackage. Repo

item.title: How to Not Be Afraid of Your Data
item.description: I’m going to be giving a talk for the PDX RLang Meetup on July 11 called “How to Not Be Afraid of Your Data: Teaching EDA using Shiny". Abstract below. Many graduate students in the basic sciences are afraid of data exploration and cleaning, which can greatly impact their downstream analysis results. By using a synthetic dataset, some simple dplyr commands, and a shiny dashboard, we teach graduate students how to explore their data and how to handle issues that can arise (missing values, differences in units).

item.title: A gRadual intRoduction to Shiny
item.description: A workshop that I’ve given on the basics of building Shiny apps. Given multiple times for PDX R User Group.

item.title: Cardiovascular Risk Workshop
item.description: A workshop given for Portland State University students exploring the difficulties of predicting cardiovascular risk using shiny for exploratory data analysis and caret for machine learning. Part 1 and Part 2. With David Dorr

item.title: Clinical Data Wrangling Workshop
item.description: 10 hour/multi-day workshop on understanding clinical data quality issues through both didactic lecturing and active data exploration. With Eilis Boudreau and Nicole Weiskopf.

item.title: Introduction to Categorical Data Analysis
item.description: LearnR tutorial for the OHSU Data Science Institute introducing students to concepts of categorical data analysis. Part of the DSIExplore package authored with Jessica Minnier.

item.title: Introduction to Categorical Data Analysis
item.description: LearnR tutorial for the OHSU Data Science Institute introducing students to concepts of categorical data analysis. Part of the DSIExplore package authored with Jessica Minnier.

item.title: A Visual Introduction to Clustering Algorithms
item.description: Interactive slides with apps to explore properties of clustering algorithms. Built with RMarkdown/Shiny

item.title: Surrogate Oncogene Explorer
item.description: One of my first shiny apps. Heatmap interface to explore the network effect of gene alterations on networked oncogene signatures. Repo
